page.title: 15Holmhill Holiday Centre
page.content: Holmhill was opened in{April 1983, but the official opening was on October 13th 1983 by{Prince Charles. He unveiled a plaque and planted a tree in the garden. Afterwards he looked around Holmhill and had tea with the guests. Holmhill is a home for people with {Multiple Sclerosis}which is a disease when the spinal cord is eaten away. Visitors go on outings to the woods, Lochindorb, the River Spey and sometimes they go up the Cairngorms. It costs{Â£230 per fortnight,}which covers{nursing}as well as full accomodation. For meals they have no special menu. The two cooks stick to vegetable fats because animal fats are bad for them. They get their food from a firm in Inverness and from Grantown.
